bib.title: Land cover mapping using Sentinel‐2 images and the semi‐automatic classification plugin: A Northern Burkina Faso case study
bib.citation: QGIS and Applications in Agriculture and Forest 2, 119-151, 2018
bib.author: Louise Leroux and Luca Congedo and Beatriz Bellón and Raffaele Gaetano and Agnès Bégué
bib.journal: QGIS and Applications in Agriculture and Forest
bib.abstract: Land cover mapping relies mainly on the classification of satellite images using supervised techniques. The European Space Agency (ESA's) Sentinel‐2 (S2) images available since 2015 and providing images at a high temporal and spatial (10 m) resolutions, offer new opportunities for land cover monitoring using remote sensing in Africa. This chapter presents a methodology for land cover mapping based on S2 and the semi‐automatic classification plugin (SCP) for quantum geographic information system (QGIS). SCP is a free and open‐source plugin developed by Luca Congedo allowing the implementation of SCP based on a variety of satellite images such as MODIS, Landsat or S2.
